200101.n: Research in Popular and Applied History I

catList: Topics in Prehistory and Ancient History: A comparative and applied workshop in the analysis of elements of popular historical consciousness, including fiction, popular journals and comic strips as well as history education materials. Focuses not only on Turkey but Southeast Europe as a whole, and creates space for exploring the possibilities of defining and producing alternative educational materials, including textbooks and/or theme kits for teachers and students. More specifically, HIST 631 is devoted to critical investigations of existing accounts of Prehistory and Ancient History in history education, as well as the possibilities of improving on such treatments. Does not count as a 600-coded research seminar for graduate students registered in regular SabancÄ± University degree programs.
